titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to ensure that whistleblowers are protected from having to submit, without just cause, to psychological or psychiatric evaluations or counseling.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 2/23/1993--Introduced. Makes a referral for psychiatric or psychological counseling or examination and the maintenance of records or reports referencing such counseling or examination a prohibited Federal personnel practice for purposes of affording protection to whistleblowers.
